fields.description:
I use a German OS but would like sourcetree in English, therefore I changed the language in the options.

Upon doing so, any changes to my repository do not display right away but only after pressing F5. So, staging files, unstaging files, checking out a different branch, it is all done but it won't show until F5 is pressed.

 

Sourcetree version 3.3.6.3829 for Win10 (not the selected version below which is wrong)
fields.summary: Language change from default results in sourcetree not updating automatically

fields.description:
*Description:*
 There is a feature which allows you to select some lines in the code and discard it or note it.
 The feature works by marking some lines in the code and then press a button in a bar at the top.

*Problem:* 
 This bar is not fixed anymore, you have to scroll at the very top of the code to use the buttons.

*NOTE:*
I am using Version 3.2.6, not 3.2.4, but I can't select 3.2.6 in the "Affects Versions/s" dropdown
fields.summary: Discard Lines bar is not sticky anymore

fields.description:
i try to index files to commit them, and they not indexing

!image-2020-02-05-11-20-26-103.png|width=1039,height=712!
fields.summary: cannt commit

fields.description: Sourcetree is adding a bunch of carat characters in my ini files when committing. It also adds a has which I assume corresponds to the specific commit, then adds a bunch of equal signs.
fields.summary: Adding extra characters after commit

fields.description:
Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks ls-remote https://github.com/Shawnhenn/01_BattleTank
Output: 
Error: fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/Shawnhenn/01_BattleTank/': Received HTTP code 404 from proxy after CONNECT

Command: perl.exe C:\Users\henne\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.3.6\tools\svn.pl info https://github.com/Shawnhenn/01_BattleTank
Output: 
Error: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
fields.summary: Not a valid Source path/URL

fields.description:
My windows 10 performed version 1909 update - KB4528760 and .NET framework 3.5 and 4.8 update - KB4532938. 

I don't know if this is related, yet the UI seems sluggish.

Seems to be failing version update check AND some analytic data (despite option is disabled) as seen in logs - going and going for a couple of days...

NOTE: Version is 3.3.6, but Jira only allows 3.3.4...

fields.summary: Sourcetree Log keeps complaining

fields.description:
On GitLab repository files are not refreshed automatically 
To SourceTree see changes user have to refresh automatically (with F5) 
All Refresh toggles in Options and Repository settings are enabled. 

It was on version  3.3.7, couldn't set it in Issue because latest "Affects Version/s" there are 3.2.2/3.2.4
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't refresh automatically

fields.description:
After installing using the downloaded windows installation file 'SourceTreeSetup-3.3.6.exe' there are no start menu shortcuts that are created.

Environment: Windows 10 Pro ver 1903 - os build# 18362.592

SourceTree Version: 3.3.6

Expected: Shortcuts are installed to the start menu

Actual: No shortcuts are installed to the start menu

Workaround: create them manually AFTER looking up the forced installation path in the user profile (I really would have prefered a choice here, but whateves).

 

Steps to Reproduce:
 # Using the SourceTreeSetup-3.3.6.exe installation file, run to install the app
 # Follow the installation wizard and complete the installation
 # No shortcuts were created for SourceTree, and for some odd reason only the installation executable shows up after the installation

I also installed using the context menu shortcut "Run as Administrator".

I just reinstalled windows, so I highly doubt that is part of the problem, but who knows stranger things have happened.

I have no idea why your Affects Version/s only lets me select up to 3.2.4, and 3.3.x does not exist.

Thank you for looking into this. Let me know if you want the specific install executable. Take care!
fields.summary: Installation does not create Start Menu shortcuts

fields.description:
At least since 3.3.6 (maybe earlier) but also in 3.3.7 and 3.3.8 the "Open in Terminal" button isn't working anymore (it's not opening the terminal)

It seems that also for custom actions that have the "Open in a separate window" checkbox checked, it's not opening the git bash window anymore when running the custom action

It seems that an identical issue existed before, but was fixed in the meantime, but apparently re-introduced:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-3896
fields.summary: "Open in Terminal" button not working anymore

fields.description:
# Create a file in a language for which syntax highlighting is available in SourceTree (I experience this bug with {{.sql}} files) and don't end it with a newline character.
 # Add the file to a repository
 # View the file diff (for the file add) in SourceTree

After the last numbered line in the file, the diff displays:
{code:java}
\  No newline at end of file
{code}
For {{.sql}} files, the line reads with {{at end of file}} coloured in blue as if they were part of the file syntax. The notice should appear all in one colour.

Reproduced in SourceTree 3.3.6, not 3.2.2, but Jira doesn't seem to permit this as an option.
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting is applied to "No newline at end of file" notice

fields.description:
Hi,

When I do any action from my first tab project (fetch, pull, push, change the selected branch, ...), the display never refresh and then I have to quit and start again SourceTree to resfresh, in order to avoid errors while managing my project branches.

 

I thinked that was from my local repository. But after recloning my project in a new local repository renamed, same behaviour again. Then when I change the order of my tabs in SourceTree, the tab in first position only have the problem to not resfresh all actions !

My version is 3.3.6 for Windows (not available in the Affects Version/s list below)

Thanks !
fields.summary: First tab never refresh
Error pushing new branches

fields.description: После добавления файла .gitignore в проект для игнорирования неиндексированных для изменений файлов в Sourcetree до перезапуска все работало отлично. После перезапуска инфо о всех данных изменения проекта были стерты. И так после каждого перезапуска.
fields.summary: .gitignore включает основные файлы проекта в игнорируемые

fields.description:
Hello!
Is it possible to add the next columns in Order Center Table:
"Company name", 'Expiration Date"?

Best regards,
Daria
fields.summary: Order Center Table

fields.description:
When I click "Stage Selected" file or "Stage All" or "Unstage All" or "Unstage Selected" view isn't changed (I mean window with staged files and unstaged files have no changes). Only after I click F5 these views are updated and contain right list of staged and unstaged files

I'm using SourceTree v3.3.6, previous version didn't have this bug.
fields.summary: Staged files are appeared only after click Refresh (F5)

fields.description:
The affected version IS 3.3.7, I have checked in my 'About Sourcetree' section...

Could it be possible this is an unreleased version?? I simply updated when the notification told me to.

 

staging files for commit requires closing and opening of software for files to appear in the staged area.

 

I also have to close and open the software to see the commit get posted to the branch.

Overall to make one commit it requires launching the program 3 times.
fields.summary: Sourcetree Windows 3.3.7 - staging / committing files is bugged

fields.description:
!image-2020-01-29-10-52-42-460.png|width=1252,height=360!
In windows 8.1 not displayed
But in windows 10 works fine
use latest version 3.3.6
Reinstallation does not help.
fields.summary: Branches are not displayed when sending.

fields.description:
Source tree will not refresh when changing branches not when files have been committed.

When I try to switch branch UI does not get refreshed that I have changed(checked out) branch.
 I need to open and close program to make it work.

If I commit I need each time to hit F5 to refresh and get new commit history.

 

Can not set affected version that is correct it is 3.3.6

!image-2020-01-28-16-09-37-391.png!
fields.summary: Source tree will not refresh

fields.description:
Custom actions are not working since upgrading from 3.2.6 to 3.3.8

No error, no dialog appears just nothing
fields.summary: Custom actions no longer work v3.3.8

fields.description:
Hello,

I recently started using Sourcetree for a fun modding project. I foolishly created a repo of the entire source even though I didn't need most of it.

Working on my D partition it had about 20GB space left but the initial commit was around 30GB.
 Sourcetree did not realize that this was not going to fit for a temporary staging location it tried to create, and eventually filled my SSD's remaining capacity (literally, 0 bytes remaining)
 The staging process then failed due to this but somehow still exited with a green status code.

Since then I'm able to use my local repo even if I made it absurdly large for my purposes, but every screen hangs and no files I stage or commit or any commits I make update the context at all, though that may have already been an issue and I just didn't notice it before.

 

However, now my D partition had 97 GB of "Temporary files" that I can't locate and as far as I know aren't Windows files (C is my OS partition). Please help me find and delete any remnants of this failed temp copy action made by Git.

MY version of Sourcetree says it's Version 3.3.6, why can't I choose it in the dropdown? O,o
!image-2020-01-27-22-42-59-024.png!
fields.summary: Sourcetree created gigabytes of temp files while staging, committing

fields.description:
Team, 

 

Trying to clone a repository but getting fatal error exception.

Clicked on Clone in Sourcetree>>>

!image-2020-01-27-14-59-29-564.png!

Tried cloning remote

!image-2020-01-27-15-01-52-616.png!  

Getting Fatal Error Exeption  - 

!image-2020-01-27-15-03-07-325.png!
fields.summary: Unable to clone GIT Repository

fields.description:
Neither the menu Action -> Open in Terminal nor the "Terminal" button on the upper right open the Embedded GIT any more.  This has stopped working in the last few days.

If I switching to the System GIT, the button and menu selection work, but I would really like to be using the embedded version.

SourceTree v3.3.6  (by the way, the Jira Affects Version/s does not have 3.3.6 as an option.)

Windows 10 Enterprise 1903
fields.summary: Terminal no longer opens

fields.description:
From File Status option, when I select a file to stage and click in the "Stage Selected" button, the file doesnt appears at the "Stage files" list. The commit button was disabled.

When I close the SourceTree application and restart it the staged file appears in the "Stage files" list. Then I can commit it

Thank you

I work with

SourceTree Version 3.3.6 (The affected version selector has only until 3.2.2)

Windows 10 Home 1903 (operating system version 18362.592) and

Java version 1.8.0_241 x86_64 architecture
fields.summary: Stage selected button doesnt works

fields.description:
Same as before: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-7168

It says fixed but you destroyed it again in version 3, apparently.
h3. Problem Definition

SourceTree gets installed in _{{%localappdata%\SourceTree\}}_ folder and it's not possible for the users to change the installation location.

Some users would like to be able to do so, e.g. because this folder is protected by an antivirus and to start the program, they have to disable the scanner once.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to select the installation location for SourceTree.
h3. Additionally

What's up with programs lately just installing themselves into appdata and in C:\Program FIles\ without asking? Why do you think you can decide for me where I want to install it? Chrome, Discord, Sourcetree and some other impudent programs that think they know better. You don't know better. I have 3 places where I install my programs:

• Windows drive C:\ on SSD for drivers and the most core stuff like .NET and C++ redistributables, Windows updates.
• Second SSD drive D:\ for programs that require performance: UE4 editor, UE4 Engines, Visual Studio, etc.
• And then I have hard drive G:\ for all other programs.

Sourcetree would go on the HDD because it doesn't require good performance SSDs provide and it isn't a core part of the system.

Let us install programs where we want, not where you want.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to select the installation location for SourceTree

fields.description:
Configuration for use with gerrit requires modifying a repos origin push to :

refs/heads/*:refs/for/*.

this worked great with 3.1.3 and earlier versions.  Now, we just get a push window with absolutely NO branches or anything so it is impossible to push changes unless auto-pushing using the checkmark to push directly upon committing.  This is ok in normal scenarios, but as soon as you enter complex scenarios like wishing to ammend a checked-out commit that someone else has pending in gerrit, which requires creating a local branch, we normally have to manually tell it to push it to the correct refs/for/correctBranch.  this is now impossible.  See screenshots that I will add as comments to the issue to see the 3.1.3 behaviour and the latest behaviour (same in all versions more recent than 3.1.3)

Please correct this, it forces our teams to remain on 3.1.3 just to function.
fields.summary: Sourcetree for windows DOES NOT WORK for ALL VERSIONS after 3.1.3 with gerrit repositories.

fields.description:
After pressing "Index selected" or "Index all", indexed items do not appear in the upper "Indexed files" section.

Indexed items appears only after tab re-switching (to another project) or app reload.

This behaviour appeared with version 3.3.7. Version 3.2.6 works fine
fields.summary: Tabs are not refreshed automatically

fields.description:
Let's say I have repo with name {{repoName}} at path A/repoName and repo with the same name in path B/repoName

In SourceTree I am able to add those repos in the different folders in the application, but when one of the repos is already opened in a tab then clicking on the other repository with the same name results in nothing until I close the already opened repo.

This is a regression that I received after update to 3.3.6, it did not happen before
fields.summary: [Regression] Source tree 3.3.6 does not open up repository if a repository with same name is already open in a tab

fields.description:
After i upgraded sourcetree to v3.3.7 i have some bugs.
 * When i click "Stage all", "Stage Selected" or "+" button, files are not move to Unstaged to Staged. I have to refresh the screen to see the changes.
 * And also after Commit, Can't see the changes. I need to restart the sourcetree to see the changes.

 

 

PS: I can't chose "Affects Version" to 3.3.7

(sorry for my english)
fields.summary: Some Bug in v3.3.7

fields.description: updated sourcetree to version 3.3.6 - on this version any action that is done on file status bat is not refreshing view. I can stage file but is is not moving to staged files
fields.summary: file status is not refreshing

fields.description:
The option "Refresh automatically when files change" no longer works in 3.3.7. It was working fine in 3.3.6. What used to happen was when SourceTree gained focus, if anything had changed it would auto refresh. This no longer occurs. (NOTE: option "Refresh when application is not in focus" is disabled)

In fact even operations initiated in Sourcetree no longer refresh. For example creating or applying a stash doesn't actually update the repo view, you have to manually hit F5 to force a refresh. Again this was working fine in 3.3.6.

This is causing major issues for us as it means you are operating in a stale view of the repo unless you keep constantly hitting F5 to force a full refresh.
fields.summary: Auto Refresh no longer working in 3.3.7

fields.description:
Here is the error message:
h1. 403 Forbidden
 * Code: AccessDenied
 * Message: Access Denied
 * RequestId: CE9F0E1186BB2036
 * HostId: gHvh4+sVa0QEDIBjl0PwnZnPnQtDfiRh2kZNFZIeZvx7l5qVNl+n6aVHNvHoXe9FasAQmUxozFo=
fields.summary: Link to latest Windows version is broken on Atlassian site

fields.description:
After updating to 3.3.7 auto-refreshing no longer works when for example
 * Staging
 * Switching Branches
 * Committing
 * Fetching
fields.summary: Auto refreshing no longer works

fields.description: In version 3.3.7 when changing branch or committing or basically anything that requires a refresh of the branch tree - No refresh happens. I have to manually press F5
fields.summary: Auto Refresh stopped working

fields.description:
When I stage or unstage a file, the screen does not get updated. The only way to see if the files are actually staged, is by pressing 'F5' so the view completely refreshes.

Previously the screen updated the view automatically (as I would have expected it to do), so this is something what worked which is now broken.
fields.summary: When I stage files the windowd does not get updated

fields.description:

1. Open [http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html]

2. Обрати культуру- Сарго

3.Обрати термінал - Врадыъвськ

4. Ввести дані (Вологість) - Value

Expected  results: 1,16

Actual result; 1,00

|13|1,14|0|
|14|2,27|0|

fields.description: qwertyuiop
fields.summary: test for
Upgrade to 3.3.6 has major problems

fields.description:
With the SourceTree version 3.3.6 using embdded git version 2.21.0 I get this error from my git repo:

 

'git log' failed with code -1:

System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: Access is denied

 

This is a new error and didn't happen before.
fields.summary: git log failed with code -1: Access is denied

fields.description:
Everytime we restart SourceTree it appears the warning on remote icon as the image below.

!image-2020-01-20-09-41-15-120.png!

We are connected to our Bitbucket server so, we use active directory integration to log in. As community people said, we use the warkaround that implicates to update connection account in repository settings. This not affect program usage, but it is very annoying why everytime we restartcomputer, it appears again and generic account is setted by default in settings.

We are working on 3.3.4 that Windows version of SourceTree, that is not listed in your affect version comboBox.
fields.summary: Warning on remote icon

fields.description:
A lot of other developers at my work experience the same issue with the latest sourcetree version 3.3.6. We had to downgrade to 3.1.2 which is the latest stable version.

 

I think 3.3.7 behaves in the same way. as 3.3.6, so is also unstable.

 

The jira menu below asks me to report a bug on a specific sourcetree version, however 3.3.6/7 isn't an option on there, so I will submit the latest version that does come up in the dropdown - 3.2.2, however I am sure that version is actually fine. Not sure why the latest versions don't come up in the dropdown. Within the actual sourcetree it prompts me to upgrade to 3.3.7, so I assume this dropdown on Jira is out of date.

 

ISSUE DESCRIPTION - {color:#FF0000}*Affects 3.3.6 and 3.3.7*{color}:

When you update to another branch, the view still shows that you are on the previous branch. Once I close the app completely and reopen, only then it is then obvious that I have checked out another branch. So it does update in the background, however the view isn't updating correctly.

 

Similarly when you stage files, it shows them in the unstaged section until I shut the app down, reopen it and then find them in the staged section. 

 

Similarly creating a new branch - it doesn't show the new branch on the side bar at all until shutting down and reopening the app.

 

Im using windows 10 if this helps.
fields.summary: Sourcetree version 3.3.6 (latest) - cannot update branches, stage files etc until force refresh

fields.description:
Preconditions:
Steps to repoduse:

1. Open http://nibulon.com/data/zakupivlya-silgospprodukcii/kalkulyator-znizhok.html 
2. Leave default values in the drop-downs
3.Enter letter into index fienlds
4. Press enter

Expected results: Enter humidity index %
Actual results: Enter refuse indicator %
fields.summary: Didcount calculator unclear error message when entering letters into index field

fields.description:
Since the 3.3.6.3829 update Sourcetree seems to fail to update the display after operations are done (committing, changing branch), always requiring a manual refresh to show the new state.

Ignore version in field below since the current release isn't available to select.
fields.summary: Failure to update display after operations

fields.description: It'd be useful to have the ability to put backgrounds on different projects in Sourcetree. It would help users differentiate between projects and ensure they're performing actions in the correct place.
fields.summary: Different backgrounds for different projects

fields.description:
When I do any of the following, operation is performed and completed but the UI does not reflect it.
||Action||Result||UI View||Current Fix||Result of Fix||
|Change Branch|New branch is selected|UI still shows old branch as selected, in bold.|Press F5 to Refresh UI|UI shows new branch selected in bold|
|Click on Stage All or Stage Selected|Files are moved to Staged Files area|UI still shows empty Staged Files area|Press F5 to Refresh UI|Staged files area shows selected files|
|Click on Pull Button|Branch is updated|UI does not show that pull was completed. Still shows bubble with number.|Press F5 to Refresh UI|UI shows pull was completed and bubble showing number goes away|

These are just a few examples. I am using Windows 10 Pro version 1909. Sourcetree shows version 3.3.6 in Help -> About Sourcetree.
fields.summary: UI Refresh Broken in 3.3.6

fields.description:
We have been seeing issues with Source tree. 
 # The source tree suddenly reported Git not found. 
 # We reinstalled source tree from website 3.3.6 version. Then while opening the repositories it will give error: git log failed with code -1. (Access is denied)  !image-2020-01-17-12-01-56-269.png!
 # This is preventing us from use Sourcetree and we are stuck.
 Regards,
 Sudharsanan
fields.summary: Facing issues with Windows 10

fields.description: After update 3.3.7 I found the file status screen doesn't get automatically updated. I will need to switch between tabs to make the file status screen updated. It was working fine previously.
fields.summary: file status screen doesn't automatically updated after update 3.3.7

fields.description:
I belong to multiple organizations using azure devOps. But this is how they show up in the remote tab. I can't tell which is which until i click and see what repos are available.

 

!image-2020-01-16-14-23-50-003.png|width=457,height=361!

We need a way to optionally give the accounts a name.
fields.summary: remote accounts need nickname

fields.description:
I'm trying to setup remote accounts for azure devops.

 

https://YOURDOMAIN.visualstudio.com

 

is being deprecated for

 

https://dev.azure.com/YOURDOMAIN/

 

If I use the second url though, I get 
{quote}Authentication failed

Failed to check login for user [************]

Insufficient authentication credentials

Sourcetree was unable to find a password for user ********* at 'dev.azure.com'.
{quote}
 

But if I use the old URL it does work. Notice that at 'dev.azure.com' does not say dev.azure.com/YOURDOMAIN/
fields.summary: Azure Devops Account don't respect full url

fields.description:
Hello 

I am Under Windows 7 and work with sourcetree 3.2.6. I want to udpate to the last version but the process failed.

After udpating and restarting sourcetree. The installer ask me for my Bitbucket account. Internet explorer open to the sourcetree sign in page, i edit my ID and password. the Windows "successfull authentification" comes up but the installer dont go further and stay on the "bitbucket account"

I need assistance

 

 

regards

 

Fabien
fields.summary: cannot update my sourcetree 3.2.6

fields.description:
After a recent SourceTree update to v3.3.6, when I stage or unstage a file, the lists of staged/unstaged files is not automatically updated.

I have to refresh the view in order for the changes to appear.

 

Note that the list of affected versions is not up to date - the latest listed is 3.2.2, but this appears in 3.3.6 (note that 3.3.4 works correctly).
fields.summary: Staging and unstaging files no longer updates the views.

fields.description:
When Windows 10 has dark app theme enabled, please use dark colors on UI

!image-2020-01-16-15-48-51-705.png!

Thanks!
fields.summary: When Windows has dark theme enabled, please use dark colors on UI

fields.description:
Hello

Would you please add possibility tree of branches shown in left pane using the fuzzy search.

!image-2020-01-16-15-47-06-397.png!

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability to filter branches tree by fuzzy search

fields.description:
Hi,

in Version 3.3.6 the UI is not responding to some buttons. I.e. pressing the "stage selected" or "stage all" will not stage the modified files. Commit is not responding as well. Also Pull and Push results in some strange in between state of the UI.

I had to revert to 3.3.4 to continue working.

I selected 3.2.2 below because it is the latest available version in this bug tracking tool.?
fields.summary: UI not responding in 3.3.6

fields.description:
Windows 10 / Sourcetree 3.3.6

The first tab will revert to the default repo name after closing and opening Sourcetree. This was previously fixed in the version before 3.3.6.
fields.summary: First tab custom name reverts to default after closing Sourcetree

fields.description:
I have my HP Elitebook Win 10 laptop hooked up to a second display. Using version 3.3.6 of Sourcetree.

When I drag Sourcetree on the second display so I can see things a bit clearer it exhibits buggy behavior namely:
 * I click files to be staged and the UI does not update, although the command was successful in the back-end
 * The UI does not update to reflect that the files have been staged, i.e. they do not move up to the staged area window
 * The UI does not update after I enter a commit message to reflect the new state of message committed
 * After I have committed and I go back to History, the pane on the right hand side does not update to show new commit.

Basically the product is unusable on a second monitor, which is where I want to be able to see things clearer, guess I will need to look at Github desktop, bemused this is not working..
fields.summary: Sourcetree history does not update and UI does not update after you Stage files or do a commit on a second monitor

fields.description:
The last couple versions seem to have broken something. I noticed it around the same time as the fix for populating the branch name when pushing a local branch to origin. The behavior is when I perform an operation like checking out a different branch by double-clicking, the UI never updates to show the new branch checked out. Or if there is a change I need to pull from origin and I click 'Pull' the UI doesn't update to show that the branch is up-to-date. I've tried the following:
 * I uninstalled, deleted <login>\AppData\Local\Atlassian, reinstalled, re-added my repo and still get the same behavior
 * It has to do with one local repo in particular. I've added other local repos, even clones of the same repo, and they seem to work fine. The repo is pretty large. I closed Sourcetree, tried a git clean -xfd, reloaded Sourcetree and the problem persists.

The version is 3.3.7 but the dropdown below isn't allowing it.
fields.summary: Main Sourcetree window doesn't update automatically

fields.description: I have to press F5 to get the UI to refresh properly.
fields.summary: Sourcetree doesn't automatically refresh screen

fields.description:
I just upgraded to v*3.3.6* of SourceTree.   (THIS VERSION IS NOT AVAILABLE TO CHOOSE IN THE AFFECTED VERSIONS DROP DOWN LIST BELOW ... WHY?!?)

Refresh is broken.  The issues include:
 * Periodic refresh to show any remote updates I needed to pull.
 * When I Stage a change, the UI doesn't refresh and it appears the that action didn't work correctly because the file(s) stay/s in the "Unstaged" section until I manually refresh
 * When I commit a change, the File(s) listed in the "Staged" area (including the commit message) continue to stay in the text box giving the appearance that the commit didn't happen.  It only updates if I manually refresh.

I've tried uninstalling/reinstalling with no change.  I've tried disabling/enabling any options I can find that relate to refresh with no obvious affect.

I just upgraded to v*3.3.6* of SourceTree.   (THIS VERSION IS NOT AVAILABLE TO CHOOSE IN THE AFFECTED VERSIONS DROP DOWN LIST BELOW ... WHY?!?)

Refresh is broken.  The issues include:
 * Periodic refresh to show any remote updates I needed to pull.
 * When I Stage a change, the UI doesn't refresh and it appears the that action didn't work correctly because the file(s) stay/s in the "Unstaged" section until I manually refresh
 * When I commit a change, the File(s) listed in the "Staged" area (including the commit message) continue to stay in the text box giving the appearance that the commit didn't happen.  It only updates if I manually refresh.

I've tried uninstalling/reinstalling with no change.  I've tried disabling/enabling any options I can find that relate to refresh with no obvious affect.
fields.summary: Refresh not working at all (AFAICT)

fields.description:
Hi!

 

We are having some issues in our environment where we have implemented Applocker whitelisting within Group Policy for our computers.

 

We have declared Sourcee by publisher to be whitelisten in applocker for our computers, but the installation on end computers still exceeds. Looks like the rule does not apply at all.

 

Path for the .exe

 

Version 3.2.6

%OSDRIVE%\USERS\ADMINISTRATOR\APPDATA\LOCAL\SOURCETREE\SOURCETREE.EXE
fields.summary: Issues with Sourcetree and Applocker

fields.description:
# If you stage selected lines, program does not refresh shown data. To refresh data you have to switch to different file or branch and next select previous file.
 # If you stage selected lines, it is impossible to unstage them.

 

Program: SourceTree for Windows, version *3.3.6*


BTW it is not possible to enter version 3.3.6 in the Affected Version on the Jira form.
fields.summary: Staging or discarding lines

fields.description:
With version 3.3.6, user needs to press F5 to refresh the UI on every action

!image-2020-01-14-10-36-25-150.png!

 

Version 3.3.6, but it doesn't have in the Affects Version list
fields.summary: UI is not updated automatically v3.3.6

fields.description: I upgrade the Sourcetree to 3.3.6, and then can not open the terminal anymore.
fields.summary: Sourcetree (Win 3.3.6) Cannot Open Terminal

fields.description:
Any changes made to my repos are not visible in SourceTree if it's open

Need to close the app everytime I make any sort of change.
fields.summary: UI Refresh

fields.description:
I just updated to Sourcetree version 3.3.6 and the automatic refresh of files no longer works.  I have to press F5 for Sourcetree to update.  Prior to the update, I did not have to do this.  I checked the settings and automatic refresh is checked.  I unchecked it, saved that changed and then checked it again but that didn't resolve the problem.

 

Note: The "Affects Version/s" option does not show version 3.3.6 as an option to select so I just selected the highest version.
fields.summary: Automatic Refresh Seems Broken

fields.description:
Since updating my Sourcetree to Version 3.3.6, I have been observing that Sourcetree's window does not reflect any immediate change after performing actions such as:
 * Discarding a file from a possible commit
 * Selecting a single file for a commit
 * Pushing a commit

The actions do actually happen. It is just that Sourcetree is not showing those actions immediately.

One workaround is to select to see the contents of another branch or move to a different view (like from the commit window to the branch contents, for example) in order to see the updated status after you have performed the action. Another workaround is to close Sourcetree and then reopen it.

(Note: could not type in 3.3.6 for the version number in the "Affects Version/s" field as the dialog would not allow me to do so).
fields.summary: Sourcetree (Win Ver 3.3.6) does not update its display after performing an action

fields.description: I can't Stage/Unstage files, I can't switch Branches. I can't really do anything at all. I'm on version 3.3.6 which wasn't available in the "Affects Version/s" drop-down for some reason.
fields.summary: SourceTree unusuable after updating to latest ver (I'm on 3.3.6)

fields.description: SourceTree exhibits a very high CPU usage when typing into the commit message window. It can be easily demonstrated simply by running SourceTree, opening an empty repository (just git init and nothing else), opening the File Status and typing random text very quickly. It gets worse with time, i.e. if I leave SourceTree running overnight, in the morning I don't even need to type too quickly, just a regular typing will be able slow down SourceTree significantly - I might see speeds as slow as two characters per second entered into the Message window, which can be quite a pain if I need to provide a detailed description of a commit. The 2.x versions were fine in this aspect, and I think even 3.1 was reasonable; 3.2 and 3.3 are not reasonable.
fields.summary: Very high CPU usage on entering a commit message

fields.description: I updated sourcetree to version 3.3.6 - on this version any action that is done on file status bat is not refreshing view. I can stage file but is is not moving to staged files , same situation when I want to remove it from there. any changes don in repository are not showing. Commit is not refreshing staged files. To refresh any action I need to switch between repositories tabs.
fields.summary: Sourcetree file status is not refreshing

fields.description:
Hi all,

I run into the following error message on the execution of a FETCH action:

*fatal: unable to access <...>: Unknown SSL protocol error in connection to <...>:443*

such problem originated with the selection of the embedded GIT client (version 1.9.5),
bundled with the Sourcetree installation (version 3.3.6).
I previously installed on my PC a system GIT client (version 2.24.1).
Setting Sourcetree to use the latter solved the issue.
Hope this could be of any utility,

Stefano Dorato
fields.summary: Issue with SSL protocol in Sourcetree older versions

fields.description: Since this version changes detection is broken (i have to press F5 or change tab with repo)!
fields.summary: Latest version does not detect changes in files

fields.description: When click the terminal icon on right top corner button there is nothing happen. The terminal is not opened on SourceTree 3.3.6. This issue occur after I installed the update on 13/01/2020
fields.summary: Terminal Is Not Opened

fields.description: When installing SourceTree 3.3.6 either by upgrade from 3.2.6 or a fresh install, the sourcetree waits for auth to complete but then returns to the Bitbucket Server or Bitbucket selection screen. After which authentication still is not possible and Bitbucket cannot be selected.
fields.summary: SourceTree 3.3.6 Does Not Authenticate

fields.description:
If you uninstall Sourcetree for Windows, the codebase remains in the /Users/../AppData/Local directories. I would expect these to be removed.

I did remove these manually at each re-install, als I suspected issues during re-installation were caused by this (but didn't pursue this further).

 

Again, Component and version selection is not ok, but I couldn't select the correct component name/version.
fields.summary: uninstall windows version doesn't uninstall the code in /Users/../AppData/Local

fields.description:
When I perform an action the view is not updated to reflect the output of the action. Like, when I doubleclick on a branch, the new branch isn't bolded,, and if I stage a file, the file is staged, but the view isn't updated to reflect that.

This happens for me on my new laptop (i9-9980-HK processor) and with a sizeable git repository (100.000+ files). On smaller repositories all works ok. Using <F5> to refesh the view also works.

The sourcetree version I use on this new laptop is 3.3.6. My old laptop had no problems like this with the 3.3.4 version, but was much less powerfull (with a i7-7000u range processor.

My workaround for now is to press <F5> after each action, so it works, but I would be happy if this issue could be resolved.

 

Note that I selected Bitbucket and version 3.2.2, but that was because I cannot select the correct versions.
fields.summary: Views don't update after an action.

fields.description:
Just updated to 3.3.6 and it is failing to move files when any of the [Stage Selected], [Stage All], or [-] or [+] are clicked.  After staging/unstaging files, if I then close SourceTree and reopen it, the files appear in the correct location.

I selected version 3.2.2 below because, once again, the list has not been updated to reflect the versions being released.  Really?

Honestly, I'm getting tired of updates that have glaring bugs like this that get in the way of me working.  Come on, this is an obvious bug; how could it have been missed during QA?
fields.summary: Stage/Unstage failing to move files

fields.description:
I just installed SourceTree (v.3.3.6) on a new Dell XPS laptop running Win 10.

I found that the SourceTree UI fails to refresh after many things like file change, staging file, unstaging file, or comiting

It was not solved by uninstall or re-install

It was not solved by turning off then on the option: tools/options/general/refresh automatically when files change

I could not easily find relevant report with Google

So I have had to manage with frequent use of F5

 

By the way. Thanks for SourceTree.  It's a wonderful tool!
fields.summary: SourceTree User Interface does not refresh automatically in a fresh Win 10 install

fields.description: You can stage files but they don't update so they stay in the unstaged window until you refresh with "F5"
fields.summary: After updating to 3.3.6, file status windows do not update after any action taken

fields.description:
The initial box comes up for the install. I click BitBucket. It opens a page and says authentication successful you can close this. Then nothing else happens. The Next button never becomes highlighted to continue with the installation

 

And what got downloaded was version 3.3.6 but it's not in the list. How do I get an older version that maybe will work
fields.summary: Cannot install SourceTree on windows 10

fields.description:
New install on W10, *3.3.6* I am unable to use Sourcetree as the interface does not refresh after any changes. For example, staging a file does briefly pop-up the log window, but nothing changes in the view. I then need to press F5 the file to move to the Staged files window.

This behaviour is the same for pretty much all actions as far as I can tell - restarting the app does sometimes not show any difference either.

It also doesn't automatically show changes made by other git applications to a repo. 

This was working fine in W7.

I have tired changing the "auto-refresh" settings and there is no change in behaviour.

Using procmon I can see Sourcetree.exe is opening the repo folder presumably to scan for changes.
fields.summary: SourceTree W10 not refreshing GUI on any action

fields.description:
Sourcetree cache images, specifically gravatar images, are being moved to the recycle bin, rather than being deleted permanently/silently. This is annoying because the recycle bin gets filled up with items that users didn't delete and don't need to know are being removed.

The original location on Windows for these images seem to all be in C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\cache\img.
fields.summary: Sourcetree cache images moved to recycle bin rather than deleted permanently

fields.description: Get this error: a7da8292071f42ab9da9f994b36ee170
fields.summary: Can't use SourceTree or fully log in

fields.description:
After upgrading to 3.1.2, the color of the hunk section header is white, which makes it more difficult to see the hunks, and is inconsistent with the rest of the interface. 

IMO these two sections should be the same color. 

!image-2020-01-08-12-27-58-701.png!

 

Seems similar to: SRCTREE-6693
fields.summary: Hunk section header color

fields.description:
Since Windows released its latest update 2019-KB4533002 on December 10, Sourtree has stopped working.

I use Windows 10 64bit, .Net Framewurk 4.8 and Sourcetree 3.3.6

This is the log in the event viewer

!image-2020-01-08-08-39-30-140.png!

!image-2020-01-08-08-43-17-052.png!
fields.summary: Sourcetree did not start with the last Windows update 2019-KB4533002

fields.description:
Source tree doesn't show the up-to-date state of files.

For example, I had 3 files with changes, I reverted one via source tree that file still is showing it on commit list. I re-opened the sourcetree and it showed the correct files (2 files)

I also changed branches and it didn't reflect on UI and still showing the wrong branch highlighted.

Clicking on stage doesn't show any change on screen (as if files have not been staged)

I re-installed the source tree and the same issue is happening.

 

It's a very dangerous situation because you trust what you see on UI but actually it is not the correct state.

 

version 3.3.6 (This version is not available on affects versions list)

windows 10
fields.summary: UI is showing out of date state

fields.description:
h3. using SourceTree 3.3.6 

Each change requires a F5 to be seen in source tree.

Have only 3 projects
fields.summary: No Auto Refresh, Only manual refresh

fields.description:
SurceTree 3.3.6
Installation on a Win7 x86 virtual machine (VirtualBox)
You must choose Bitbucket or Bitbucket Server.
- Bitbucket opens the browser, I authorize myself and nothing happens
- Bitbucket Server does not accept any login (there should be some help what you mean)

The described process is troublesome after you open the browser, stere installers were better.
I ended up installing other software, there is no obligation to use your software.

Regards
Zbigniew
fields.summary: installation and registration issue

fields.description:
When starting Sourcetree, the remote button is shown with an exclamation annotation, supposedly because Sourcetree does not know how to open the remote in a browser. However, if I open the repository settings and change the account type from "Generic" to "Bitbucket" or "Github" and do not edit the SSH url to the remote, then save the change, the annotation goes away and Sourcetree can successfully open the remote. If I then close Sourcetree and reopen, it has forgotten the repository type and set it back to "Generic" and cannot open the remote browser. I can repeat this any number of times.

 

Using Sourcetree 3.3.4, but was not allowed to select that below.

 

I have recorded a video and posted it here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vyqWNbmuezH7xQ_SkudXHkXXCfk02AlX/view?usp=sharing
fields.summary: Sourcetree forgets the account type for a repository

fields.description: The certificate used to sign Sourcetree 3.3.6 (and 3.2.4) is invalid and expired on 11/27/2019. This certificate needs to be renewed before this software will pass through our security measures.
fields.summary: DigiCert Certificate Expired

fields.description:
I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling SourceTree, as well as deleting folder Local\SourceTree but it doesn't fix the missing SourceTree icon.

The icon is the white paper icon, I think that is mentioned here.  But this doesn't just happen after updating, but I can never see the proper SourceTree icon.

The shortcut that opens after you try to run SourceTree is showing a "start in" location that is old/outdated.  Not sure why.

The Update.exe executable that runs has just the paper icon, so it makes sense that the icon on the task bar isn't the SourceTree icon.

Just annoying, unprofessional that the app's icon doesn't behave like other apps.

 

!image-2020-01-02-11-03-16-427.png!
fields.summary: Icon on Windows 7 isn't right, nor is shortcut

fields.description:
Using Sourcetree Version: 3.3.6

Windows 10 Home (Version 1909, OS Build 18363.535)

This is a new PC with a fresh install of SourceTree and I noticed that any operations require a manual refresh (F5) for them to actually show up and display properly under the branch listing and commit window. For example, if I attempt to switch to another branch on my list, The "Switching Branch" dialog shows up and the code/files does/do get updated properly.  But the display itself does not get updated properly until I hit F5. This is a minor annoyance.
fields.summary: Operations require manual refresh (F5) to show updates in commit/branch panels

fields.description:
It is a total pain to create repos for existing projects. either you need to create them independent in a new folder and copy the old project over there (and loose all dependencies) or you need to hack around with the console. 

This is for new users painful as well as for skilled user with many projects. The question is asked several times, not only to Atlassian (check froum of gitlab, github, gitkraken, fork ...), but all git providers refused it. 

 

Suggestion:

1. Allow to create new repos from existing projects (not empty) folder.

2. Allow capital letters in the slug, convert aromatically or ask BEFORE create to change it to avoid a fatal f***up
fields.summary: Create local and remote repository from existing project in one step

fields.description:
1) Make changes in the working directory.

2) Select "Create Patch"

3) Try to stage a change file from any of the UI options (+ icon, stage file, stage hunk).

4) Observe the screen redraw, but nothing is staged, so you can't create the patch

The workaround is to create an issue branch, commit the changes, and create the patch from the branch.

The actual version is 3.3.4, but Jira won't let me enter that.
fields.summary: Can no longer stage changes from working directory during Create Patch

fields.description: I have to hit F5 in order to see any changes show up. For some reason the auto refresh is not working any longer. The version is 3.3.6.3829, but there isn't a selection for version 3.3.6 available.
fields.summary: View not refreshing
